translations.english_saheeh: By the dawn
translations.english_hilali_khan: 1. By the dawn;
translations.english_rwwad: By the dawn,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1913]- Usually interpreted as the first ten nights of the month of Dhul-Ḥijjah.
footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.89:2) Narrated Ibn ‘Abbâs رضي الله عنهما: The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "No good deeds done on other days are superior to those done on these (first ten days of Dhul-Hijjah)." Then some Companions of the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "Not even Jihâd ?" He replied, "Not even Jihâd, except that of a man who does it by putting himself and his property in danger (for Allâh’s sake) and does not return with any of those things." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.2, Hadith No.86).

translations.english_saheeh: And [by] ten nights[1913]
translations.english_hilali_khan: By the ten nights (i.e. the first ten days of the month of Dhul-Hijjah)[1],
translations.english_rwwad: and the ten nights,

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.89:3) "Even" and "Odd" is interpreted differently by different religious scholars. Some say: Even is the Day of Slaughtering of the Sacrifices, i.e. 10th of Dhul-Hijjah, and Odd is the Day of ‘Arafah (Hajj ), i.e. 9th of Dhul-Hijjah. Others say: Even is all the creatures and Odd is Allâh. Some say it is the compulsory congregational prayer, i.e. Maghrib is Witr , and the other four prayers are Shaf‘

translations.english_saheeh: And [by] the even [number] and the odd
translations.english_hilali_khan: And by the even and the odd (of all the creations of Allâh).[2]
translations.english_rwwad: and the even and the odd,

translations.english_saheeh: And [by] the night when it passes,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And by the night when it departs.
translations.english_rwwad: and by the night when it comes,

arabic_text: هَلۡ فِي ذَٰلِكَ قَسَمٞ لِّذِي حِجۡرٍ
phonetic: 89.5 Hal Fī Dhālika Qasamun Lidhī Ĥijrin

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1914]- Based upon the following verses, what has been sworn to by Allāh is that He will certainly punish the disbelievers.

translations.english_saheeh: Is there [not] in [all] that an oath [sufficient] for one of perception?[1914]
translations.english_hilali_khan: There is indeed in them (the above oaths) sufficient proofs for men of understanding (and that, they should avoid all kinds of sins and disbeliefs)!
translations.english_rwwad: are these oaths not sufficient for those who have sense?

arabic_text: أَلَمۡ تَرَ كَيۡفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ

translations.english_saheeh: Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with ʿAad -
translations.english_hilali_khan: Saw you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) not how your Lord dealt with ‘Âd (people)
translations.english_rwwad: Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with ‘Ād

footnotes.english_saheeh:
[1915]- Another name for the first people of ʿAad, to whom Prophet Hūd was sent.
[1916]- Supporting their tents or buildings.

translations.english_saheeh: [With] Iram[1915] - who had lofty pillars,[1916]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Of Iram (who were very tall) like (lofty) pillars,
translations.english_rwwad: of Iram, who were people of great stature,

arabic_text: ٱلَّتِي لَمۡ يُخۡلَقۡ مِثۡلُهَا فِي ٱلۡبِلَٰدِ
phonetic: 89.8 Allatī Lam Yukhlaq Mithluhā Fī Al-Bilādi

translations.english_saheeh: The likes of whom had never been created in the land?
translations.english_hilali_khan: The like of which were not created in the land?
translations.english_rwwad: the like of whom had never been created in the land;

phonetic: 89.9 Wa Thamūda Al-Ladhīna Jābū Aş-Şakhra Bil-Wādi

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.89:9) "And you hew out in the mountains, houses with great skill." [The Qur’ân, Verse 26:149].

translations.english_saheeh: And [with] Thamūd, who carved out the rocks in the valley?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And (with) Thamûd (people), who hewed out rocks in the valley (to make dwellings)? [3]
translations.english_rwwad: and Thamūd, who carved out the rocks in the Valley;

translations.english_saheeh: And [with] Pharaoh, owner of the stakes?[1917]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And (with) Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) who had the stakes (to torture men by binding them to the stakes)?
translations.english_rwwad: and the mighty and powerful Pharaoh?

translations.english_saheeh: [All of] whom oppressed within the lands
translations.english_hilali_khan: Who did transgress beyond bounds in the lands (in the disobedience of Allâh).
translations.english_rwwad: All of them transgressed in the land,

translations.english_saheeh: And increased therein the corruption.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And made therein much mischief.
translations.english_rwwad: and spread therein much corruption,

translations.english_saheeh: So your Lord poured upon them a scourge of punishment.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So your Lord poured on them different kinds of severe torment.
translations.english_rwwad: so your Lord poured upon them a scourge of punishment.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, your Lord is in observation.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, your Lord is Ever Watchful (over them).
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, your Lord is ever vigilant.

arabic_text: فَأَمَّا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ إِذَا مَا ٱبۡتَلَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَأَكۡرَمَهُۥ وَنَعَّمَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّيٓ أَكۡرَمَنِ
phonetic: 89.15 Fa'ammā Al-'Insānu 'Idhā Mā Abtalāhu Rabbuhu Fa'akramahu Wa Na``amahu Fayaqūlu Rabbī 'Akramani

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1918]- He is proud rather than grateful, attributing the favor to his own merit.

translations.english_saheeh: And as for man, when his Lord tries him and [thus] is generous to him and favors him, he says, "My Lord has honored me."[1918]
translations.english_hilali_khan: As for man, when his Lord tries him by giving him honour and bounties, then he says (in exultation): "My Lord has honoured me."
translations.english_rwwad: As for man, when he is tested by his Lord by honoring him and bestowing blessings upon him, he says, “My Lord has [deservedly] honored me!”

arabic_text: وَأَمَّآ إِذَا مَا ٱبۡتَلَىٰهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيۡهِ رِزۡقَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّيٓ أَهَٰنَنِ
phonetic: 89.16 Wa 'Ammā 'Idhā Mā Abtalāhu Faqadara `Alayhi Rizqahu Fayaqūlu Rabbī 'Ahānani

translations.english_saheeh: But when He tries him and restricts his provision, he says, "My Lord has humiliated me."
translations.english_hilali_khan: But when He tries him by straitening his means of life, he says: "My Lord has humiliated me!"
translations.english_rwwad: But when he is tested by restricting his provision, he says, “My Lord has [undeservedly] humiliated me!”

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1919]- It is not like you imagine. Rather, Allāh tries people through prosperity and hardship and rewards both gratitude and patience with honor in the Hereafter.

translations.english_saheeh: No![1919] But you do not honor the orphan
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay! But you treat not the orphans with kindness and generosity (i.e. you neither treat them well, nor give them their exact right of inheritance)!
translations.english_rwwad: No indeed! You are not kind to the orphan,

translations.english_saheeh: And you do not encourage one another to feed the poor.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And urge not one another on the feeding of Al-Miskîn (the poor)!
translations.english_rwwad: nor do you urge one another to feed the needy,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1920]- Not caring whether it is lawful or unlawful.

translations.english_saheeh: And you consume inheritance, devouring [it] altogether,[1920]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And you devour the inheritance all with greed.
translations.english_rwwad: and you greedily consume the entire inheritance,

translations.english_saheeh: And you love wealth with immense love.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And you love wealth with much love.
translations.english_rwwad: and love wealth immensely.

arabic_text: كـَلَّآۖ إِذَا دُكَّتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ دَكّٗا دَكّٗا

translations.english_saheeh: No! When the earth has been leveled - pounded and crushed
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay! When the earth is ground to powder.
translations.english_rwwad: No indeed! When the earth is crushed over and over,

phonetic: 89.22 Wa Jā'a Rabbuka Wa Al-Malaku Şaffāan Şaffāan

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1921]- To pass judgement. See footnote to 2:19

translations.english_saheeh: And your Lord has come[1921] and the angels, rank upon rank,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And your Lord comes with the angels in rows.
translations.english_rwwad: and your Lord comes with the angels, rank after rank,

arabic_text: وَجِاْيٓءَ يَوۡمَئِذِۭ بِجَهَنَّمَۚ يَوۡمَئِذٖ يَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ
phonetic: 89.23 Wa Jī'a Yawma'idhin Bijahannama Yawma'idhin Yatadhakkaru Al-'Insānu Wa 'Anná Lahu Adh-Dhikrá

translations.english_saheeh: And brought [within view], that Day, is Hell - that Day, man will remember, but how [i.e., what good] to him will be the remembrance?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And Hell will be brought near that Day. On that Day will man remember, but how will that remembrance (then) avail him?
translations.english_rwwad: and Hell is brought near on that Day – this is when man will understand, but what is the use of that understanding?

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1922]- The everlasting life of the Hereafter.

translations.english_saheeh: He will say, "Oh, I wish I had sent ahead [some good] for my life."[1922]
translations.english_hilali_khan: He will say: "Alas! Would that I had sent forth (good deeds) for (this) my life!"
translations.english_rwwad: He will say, “Would that I had sent forth something for my [eternal] life!”

translations.english_saheeh: So on that Day, none will punish [as severely] as His punishment,
translations.english_hilali_khan: So on that Day none will punish as He will punish.
translations.english_rwwad: None can punish as He punishes on that Day,

translations.english_saheeh: And none will bind [as severely] as His binding [of the evildoers].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And none will bind (the wicked, disbelievers and polytheists) as He will bind.
translations.english_rwwad: and none can bind as He binds.

translations.english_saheeh: [To the righteous it will be said], "O reassured soul,
translations.english_hilali_khan: (It will be said to the pious believers of Islamic Monotheism): "O (you) the one in (complete) rest and satisfaction!
translations.english_rwwad: [It will be said to the believer,] “O the tranquil soul!

translations.english_saheeh: Return to your Lord, well-pleased and pleasing [to Him],
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Come back to your Lord well-pleased (yourself) and well-pleasing (unto Him)!
translations.english_rwwad: Return to your Lord, well pleased and pleasing [to Him].

translations.english_saheeh: And enter among My [righteous] servants
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Enter you then among My (honoured) slaves,
translations.english_rwwad: Join My [righteous] slaves,

translations.english_saheeh: And enter My Paradise."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And enter you My Paradise!"
translations.english_rwwad: and enter My Paradise.”
